intro: Dicellandra scandens, commonly known as the climbing dicellandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its twining growth habit and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
